article.headline: 3M to develop rapid coronavirus test with MIT researchers
article.body: Shares of 3M Co. MMM, +0.94% gained 0.6% in premarket trading on Tuesday after the company said it is developing a rapid diagnostic test for COVID-19 that would be used at the point of care. The test, which is being jointly developed by researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, has been selected by the National Institutes of Health for commercial support and has received $500,000 from the U.S. government. 3M's stock is down 12.2% since the start of the year, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has declined 2.3%.
